H0.text: They make the soil clean is the best description of how earthworms improve soil as they eat dead plant material.

H1.text: They keep disease out of the soil, which best describes how earthworms improve soil as they eat dead plant material.

H2.text: They recycle nutrients into the soil is the best description of how earthworms improve soil as they eat dead plant material.

H3.text: They remove extra water from the soil as earthworms eat dead plant material.

A4.text: When the worm excretes this in the form of casts, deposited on the surface or deeper in the soil, minerals and plant nutrients are changed to an accessible form for plants to use.

A5.text: Earthworms promote the formation of nutrient-rich casts (globules of soil, stable in soil mucus) that have high soil aggregation and soil fertility and quality.
